item.value: Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall. The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The Earth orbits the Sun at an average speed of 29.79 km/s ( 67,000 miles/hour).
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
In 1783 Sebastien Lenormand was first to demonstrate the parachute. In Missouri 1912, Captain Berry was the first to jump from a plane with a parachute.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is only 4.6 billion years old.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants. Los Angeles is in second place. It has 3.8 million people.
The moon is just over one quarter the size of the earth.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
